plugins.name: Table flipper
plugins.description:
Hey :)

This plugin lets you flip the table's layout, from rows to column, or columns to rows.

If the table is an instance, it will detach it.


If you like it, please like and comment. It will help others to see the value as well :)


Watch demo.

Support my work here <3


How to use:

  1. Select a frame that contains only a table
  2. Select the flip direction


Important notes:

Make sure to select the right direction, otherwise it will not work properly, and make sure the table is well built:

  1. Same amount of cells in all columns
  2. Same amount of cells in all rows
  3. Same width to all cells in row/column

Otherwise it will not work properly. Super important to how the plugin works.


How it works behind the scenes:

I calculate how many cells the table has by:

  1. How many rows/columns
  2. How many cells the first row/column has (I assume all others have the same number of cells).
  3. I go in a loop and re-arrange the table ( rows/columns * cells times)


Enjoy :)


(Image source: https://www.flickr.com/photos/skkorea/13529912033)
plugins.tagline: Flip table's layout direction from rows to columns / columns to rows

plugins.name: DT组件筛选 DT Component Selector
plugins.description:
Introduction:

The DT Component Selector plugin is a Figma tool designed to quickly filter and locate DT components in your design. This plugin helps designers improve their workflow by efficiently identifying and managing DT components in complex layouts.


Function Description:

  1. Filters all components in the selected frame that match the DT component criteria.
  2. Categorizes components into those visible on the canvas and those outside the visible bounds.
  3. Supports quick location of selected components for further manipulation.


How to Use:

  1. Select a frame and click the "Show Component Filter" button.
  2. The plugin will automatically filter the qualifying DT components, displaying the results as visible and non-visible components.
  3. Click the "Locate" button next to a component to quickly locate it in your design.


Notes:

  1. The plugin filters only DT components that match predefined criteria, ignoring other types.
  2. Make sure to select a frame for the plugin to function correctly.


介绍：

DT组件筛选插件是一款用于快速筛选并定位设计中的DT组件的Figma插件。该插件旨在提高设计师在处理复杂设计时的工作效率，帮助用户更快速地找到并操作DT组件。


功能说明：

  1. 筛选出当前画板中符合DT组件定义的所有组件。
  2. 可对组件进行分类：在画板可见范围内和不可见范围内的组件。
  3. 支持快速定位所选组件，并进行进一步操作。


使用方法：

  1. 选择一个画板并点击“显示组件筛选”按钮。
  2. 插件会自动筛选符合条件的DT组件，结果将分为可见组件和不可见组件进行展示。
  3. 点击组件名称旁的“定位”按钮即可快速定位到该组件。


注意事项：

  1. 插件仅会筛选符合预定义条件的DT组件，其他组件将被忽略。
  2. 请确保您选择的是一个画板，否则插件将无法运行。

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Quickly filter and locate DT components in your design

plugins.name: コーディングパネル
plugins.description:
「コーディング用の数値がわかりにくい。」

「なんか色が違うと思ったらブレンドモードになってた！」

「字間の設定をよく見逃してしまう・・。」

コーディングをしていてそんな経験はありませんか？


このプラグインでは、レイヤーを選択するとコーディングで必要な数値を、タイポグラフィ、コンテンツ、エフェクトのカテゴリに分けてハイライトします。

さらに、一部コーディングの数値に自動計算したり、カラーコードのHEX値とRGB値の切替えができたり、フレームやグループ化されたレイヤーでもテキストを取得してワンクリックでコピーする機能も追加しました。


多くのデザインデータからコーディングしてきたコーダーが作った、コーダーのためのプラグインです。Figmaでコーディングするなら、ぜひ使ってみてください。


【タイポグラフィ】

テキストレイヤーに反応して、書体、太さ、文字サイズ、行間、字間、文字揃え（上下・左右）、テキスト内容を表示します。


【コンテンツ】

幅、高さ、外見透過、ブレンドモード、塗り、線の情報を表示します。


【エフェクト】

エフェクトの情報を表示します。

インナーシャドウとドロップシャドウは詳細を表示しますが、それ以外のエフェクトはエフェクト名のみ表示します。
plugins.tagline: テキストやコンテンツ、エフェクトなどのコーディングで使用する情報を分かりやすく表示します。騙されたと思って使ってみて。

plugins.name: Fancy Figma to Bricks builder
plugins.description:
Forget doing things twice — design smarter by managing your variables, color palette and designs in Figma, then effortlessly transfer everything into Bricks builder with just a few clicks.


Plugin video: https://youtu.be/5_52ZX3yfGQ


Website: https://fancyframework.com/figma-plugin/


Purchase an early adopter license for 10 instances*: BUY NOW

Documentation: https://fancyframework.com/docs/

Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/fancybricks

YouTube: https://youtube.com/@fancybricks


* An instance refers to each individual installation of the software, whether on different devices or platforms. For example, if you activate the license on the desktop app and also use it on the web version, even with the same user account, it will count as two separate instances.


How it works?


Fancy Framework for Figma streamlines your workflow in three simple steps — from defining your design system in Figma to building real pages in Bricks. Here’s how:


Set up your design variables in Figma

Define your entire design system directly in Figma — colors, typography, spacing, and more. Group and name your variables for better clarity and consistency across your designs.


Export your variables and color palette to Bricks

With just a few clicks, convert your Figma variables into Bricks-compatible values. Keep your color system consistent across design and development — no need to manually recreate anything.


Copy from Figma, paste into Bricks

Select any Auto Layout section in Figma, copy it, and paste it directly into the Bricks editor. Supports autolayout, semantic tags, classes, grids and native Bricks elements — just like you designed it.


Main features

Fancy Figma to bricks builder plugin gives you everything you need to streamline your workflow: organize design variables, export color palettes, and paste fully structured sections directly into Bricks. No more duplicated effort — just clean, scalable, and efficient web design.


Advanced variable support

Use calc, rem, number and clamp() directly in your Figma variables for greater flexibility and control.


Auto-generate color variations

Generate transparent, darkened, and lightened versions of your colors instantly — no need to create them manually. Perfect for building accessible and consistent UI systems.


Export dynamic variables to Bricks

Thanks to support for clamp, calc, rem, and numeric operations, your Figma variables are ready for real-world usage inside Bricks — no tweaks needed.


Bricks-ready color palette export

Automatically export your color palette from Figma, linked directly to your variables — ready to import into Bricks and use seamlessly across your entire site.


Seamless copy-paste from Figma to Bricks

Copy any section built with Auto Layout in Figma and paste it directly into Bricks — layout structure, classes, and semantic tags all preserved.


Copy-Paste Features


Built for Auto Layout

By following best practices, your sections will copy perfectly into Bricks — layout, spacing, and hierarchy intact. Check out my free figma course: https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLbc4J3wWyVcdnL9A_UA-WdE2tXRUW-I8O


Semantic HTML tag support

Your Figma sections can include semantic tags like [section], [container], [ul], [li], [h1–h6], [p], [span], and more. Perfect for SEO, accessibility, and clean markup.


Support for display grid

Display grid support uses (grid-x) (grid-x-x) to apply display: grid in Bricks automatically when pasting.


Class-friendly workflow

Use meaningful class names in Figma and watch them transfer seamlessly into Bricks. Combine with utility classes for maximum flexibility and control.


Bricks-native element compatibility

Paste sections that automatically map to Bricks' native elements like:

  1. Buttons
  2. Links
  3. SVG
  4. Forms
  5. Tabs
  6. Accordions
  7. Nav menu
  8. Logo
  9. Counters
  10. Breadcrumbs
  11. Filter search
  12. Filter checkbox
  13. More will be added
plugins.tagline: The ultimate web design workflow for Bricks Builder

plugins.name: QR Code Figma
plugins.description:
QR Code Generator for Figma


Create beautiful, customizable QR codes directly in Figma with this powerful plugin. Perfect for designers, marketers, and developers who need to quickly generate and place QR codes in their designs.


Features

✨ Instant Generation

- Generate QR codes in seconds

- Support for URLs, text, and more

- Real-time preview


🎨 Full Customization

- Custom colors for both foreground and background

- Adjustable size and margin

- Multiple border styles (solid, dashed, none)

- Custom border width

- Dark/Light mode support


🖼️ Logo Integration

- Add your brand logo to QR codes

- Automatic logo sizing and positioning

- Maintain QR code readability


📱 Multiple Formats

- PNG and JPEG export options

- High-quality output

- Optimized for both print and digital


📋 History & Management

- Save your recent QR codes

- Quick access to previous designs

- Easy history management


Use Cases

- Marketing materials

- Business cards

- Product packaging

- Event tickets

- Digital menus

- Social media graphics

- Print materials

- Website designs


How to Use

1. Enter your text or URL

2. Customize the appearance

3. Add your logo (optional)

4. Generate the QR code

5. Place it directly in your design

6. Download or export as needed


Perfect For

- Designers creating marketing materials

- Marketers adding QR codes to campaigns

- Developers needing QR codes for apps

- Businesses creating branded QR codes

- Anyone who needs professional QR codes quickly


Note: This plugin requires an active internet connection to generate QR codes.
plugins.tagline: Create, Customize & Generate QR Codes in Seconds - Right in Figma!

plugins.name: Frameverse
plugins.description:
Frameverse - Share Frames Seamlessly


Frameverse is a powerful Figma plugin that revolutionizes design sharing. Generate secure tokens for your frames and assets, allowing instant access across teams and continents. Share specific design elements without exposing your entire file, maintaining control while enabling seamless collaboration.



✨ Key Features


- One-Click Sharing: Select any frame, section, or slice and generate a shareable token instantly

- Smart Import: Paste a token to import frames with perfect fidelity, maintaining all properties including:

- Layout structures and constraints

- Shapes and component instances

- Vector paths and effects

- Fonts and text styles

- Images and fills


- Batch Operations: Share or import multiple frames at once

- Preview Panel: Visual preview of selected frames before sharing



🎯 Perfect For


- Design System Teams sharing component updates

- Agencies sharing design patterns with clients

- Product Teams maintaining consistent layouts across files

- Anyone looking to transfer frames between files without manual recreation



💡 How It Works


1. Select the frames you want to share

2. Click "Generate Token" to create a unique share code

3. Share the token with your team

4. Recipients paste the token to import frames with all properties intact (Eg: YJS-hoo)



🔒 Security & Performance


- Tokens are temporary and expire after 24 hours

- No data persistence - files are fully purged after token expiration

- Share specific frames without exposing entire files

- Intelligent compression and processing for optimal performance

- Progressive loading for larger frames



No account required. Start sharing frames in seconds!



Questions or feedback? Contact us
plugins.tagline: Exchange assets with the most intuitive frame sharing solution for Figma

plugins.name: MGS Composer - Exporter
plugins.description:
Export your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project

Streamline your design workflow with the MGS Composer Exporter. This plugin bridges the gap between Figma's design environment and MGS Composer, enabling you to create stunning user interfaces in Figma and transfer them to Composer for further development.


Features

Automatic Asset Generation: Composer generates assets automatically from the exported data, saving time and effort.

Preserved Design Hierarchy: Composer mirrors Figma's design tree as closely as possible, ensuring an accurate translation of your design.

Component Support: Assets generated from Figma Components are treated as a shared resource, saving memory on your target device.


Detailed Guide


How to Use:

  1. Install the Plugin: Add it to your Figma workspace.
  2. Run the Plugin: An export window will appear on the right side of Figma's interface.
  3. Select Page: Navigate to the page you want to export from and click Select Page.
  4. Mark Objects for Export: The export window will list top-level objects. These will be translated to Screens in Composer. Select objects by clicking on them or their children in the Figma design, which will automatically mark them in the export window.
  5. Set Export Options: After selecting objects, choose from two options:
  6. Flatten Group Components during export: Flattens groups into a single image in the exported data.
  7. Export all primitives as .svg assets: Exports vectors like rectangles, lines, and text as SVG assets.
  8. Generate Data: Click the Generate Data button. The export window will show a view of all exported objects and a corresponding JSON file. You can add custom properties to the objects here in the upper view.
  9. Export File: Click the Export button at the bottom of the window and select a location to save the file.
  10. Open MGS Composer: Launch Composer and create a new design or open an existing one with a screen size adequate for your Figma content.
  11. Import Project: In Composer, go to "File > Import" and select Figma Composer Project. Confirm the prompt that appears.
  12. Done: Composer will import the file and add new screens, assets, and widgets to your design.


Support & Feedback:

MGS User Guide

MGS Forum
plugins.tagline: Exports your Figma Design into a Microchip Graphics Composer Project.

plugins.name: Figmentation
plugins.description:
🪄 Figmentation – where Figma meets Autodocumentation


Tired of manual documentation?

Figmentation automates the process of extracting design tokens directly from your Figma components — including colors, typography, spacing, borders, and effects.

With just one click, Figmentation creates a clean, organized annotation frame beside your component — making handoff easier for developers and keeping your design system crystal clear.


Built by a designer who needed this — and figured others might too.


💡 What it does:

Extracts bound design tokens from your components

Supports multiple naming conventions (camelCase, kebab-case, etc.)

Automatically detects and documents:

Backgrounds, text colors, border colors

Font sizes, families, weights, line heights, letter spacing

Padding, gap, corner radius, stroke weight

Shadows and blurs

Generates readable and structured annotation layers

Keeps token names consistent with your system — or generates smart fallback names


🔧 Use cases:

Design system maintenance

Dev handoff

Figma token organization

Fast, scalable documentation for UI libraries


✨ Made for:

Product designers

Design system leads

Developers using Figma tokens

Anyone who hates repetitive documentation


🎯 Figmentation – where Figma meets Autodocumentation.

Crafted with care by someone who gets it.

plugins.name: Link Manager
plugins.description:
Figma でのリンク管理に悩んでいませんか？


デザイン内のリンクが散らばっていて、手作業で整理するのが大変…。

Link Manager を使えば、リンクの検出・削除が数クリックで完了！

リンクの整理をもっと簡単に。スッキリとしたデザイン管理 を実現しましょう！🚀


Managing links in Figma can be frustrating—especially when working on large projects with scattered hyperlinks.


With Link Manager, you can effortlessly find, copy, and remove links from your Figma files in just a few clicks.


No more clutter, no more manual cleanups. Keep your designs neat, organized, and efficient with this powerful yet easy-to-use plugin! 🚀


🔹 主な機能 | Key Features


✅ 🔍 自動リンク検出 | Auto-Detect Hyperlinks – 選択したフレーム内の すべてのリンクを瞬時にリストアップ

✅ 🗑 簡単なリンク削除 | Easy Link Removal – 選択したリンクを削除 or すべてのリンクを一括削除

✅ 🌍 多言語対応 | Multi-language Support – 英語 & 日本語 に対応



🔹 使い方 | How to Use


🇯🇵 日本語

1️⃣ 「Detect Links」 をクリック → デザイン内のリンクをリストアップ

2️⃣ 「Remove Selected」 で 選択したリンクを削除

3️⃣ 「Remove All」 ですべてのリンクを一括削除


💡 Figma 内のリンク管理をスマートに！


🇬🇧 English

1️⃣ Click “Detect Links” to scan your Figma file for all hyperlinks

2️⃣ Select specific links and click “Remove Selected” to delete them

3️⃣ Click “Remove All” to erase every hyperlink from your design


💡 Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!



🎯 こんな方におすすめ | Who is This Plugin For?


🇯🇵 日本語

🔹 デザイナー - Figma ファイルを整理したい

🔹 チーム - Figma でリンクを共有・管理するプロジェクトに最適

🔹 開発者 - デザインからすべてのリンクを抽出したい

🔹 プロジェクトマネージャー - レビュー時にリンクを整理したい

🔹 リンクを手軽に管理したいすべてのユーザー！


🇺🇸 English

🔹 UI/UX Designers - Keep your Figma files structured

🔹 Teams - Perfect for projects with shared links

🔹 Developers - Extract all links from a design efficiently

🔹 Project Managers - Easily organize links during reviews

🔹 Anyone who wants hassle-free hyperlink management!
plugins.tagline: Easily manage hyperlinks in Figma with just a few clicks!

plugins.name: Consistify
plugins.description:
With the Consistify plugin, you can be be able to:


Detect Design Inconsistencies: Scan multiple frames for discrepancies in font styles, colors, buttons, iconography(coming soon), spacing, and navigation elements(coming soon) etc.


Get Visual Feedback: Receive clear, color-coded tags indicating inconsistencies, with direct frame references and numerical comparisons for easy analysis.


Streamline Workflow(coming soon): Highlight design issues directly in the UI, allowing users to click and focus on problematic frames, helping maintain design system integrity across projects.


To use the Consistify plugin, follow these steps:


Open your design in Figma.

Select at least 2 frames you want to compare for inconsistencies.

Run the Plugin


Advanced Features(coming son:


Accessibility Checker: Analyze contrast ratios in real-time for WCAG compliance.

Component Management: Identify duplicate components and track usage statistics.


Design System Health Monitoring: Flag inconsistent color usage, manual overrides on text styles, and mismatched font sizes.


The plugin is a must-have tool for ensuring cohesive, well-structured designs while saving time on manual checks.

plugins.name: Eggstractor
plugins.description:
Design-to-code, simplified


Eggstractor is a Figma plugin that exports designs as SCSS mixins, allowing developers to build components their way while keeping styling updates seamless. By separating structure from styling, Eggstractor ensures that design changes don’t disrupt component architecture. And with automated code generation for updates, dramatically speed up iteration and reduce development overhead.


Designers: Easily update component designs and push them directly to code—no developer implementation needed.


Developers: Maintain full control over component structure while receiving Figma-driven style updates as branched pull requests for review before merging.


For an end-to-end setup and demo, check out our Getting Started Guide.


How It Works

  1. Connect to your GitHub repo.
  2. Structure your coded components to use SCSS mixins.
  3. When designs change in Figma, run the plugin to generate updated SCSS mixins.
  4. Review, then click to create a pull request.
  5. A developer reviews and merges, and the changes are live.


Current Status

Eggstractor is actively in development. While not all CSS properties are supported yet, our roadmap includes full support for core CSS properties, followed by an open-source design system built to leverage Eggstractor.


Eggstractor is an open source project by Bitovi. Contributions are welcome! Get involved at github.com/bitovi/eggstractor.


Need some help?

Check out our Getting Started Guide.


Need more help?

Chat with us on Discord | Send GitHub feature requests | Email to support@bitovi.com


Need pros to help design & build your design system or app? That’s Bitovi!
plugins.tagline: Design-to-code, simplified

plugins.name: Codex — Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary — just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you’re 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don’t have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
118915.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: get-antd-token
plugins.description:
# get-antd-token - Ant Design Token 匹配工具


## 简介


get-antd-token 是一个专为设计师和开发者打造的 Figma 插件，帮助您快速匹配 Figma 设计元素与 Ant Design 的设计 Token，实现无缝的设计与开发协作。


## 主要功能


- 🎨 **精准颜色匹配**：选择任意元素，即时获取对应的 Ant Design 颜色 Token

- 💧 **半透明颜色识别**：智能识别半透明颜色，并提供 `rgba(token.colorXXX, 0.x)` 格式的替代方案

- 🔍 **边框与内边距识别**：自动检测元素的圆角和内边距，匹配相应的 borderRadius 和 padding Token

- 📝 **模板管理系统**：支持导入/导出 Token 模板，完全兼容 Ant Design 的主题配置文件

- 🔄 **一键复制**：快速复制 Token 值，轻松粘贴到代码中


## 插件优势


- **提高设计开发效率**：不再需要手动查找颜色代码或测量边距

- **保持设计一致性**：确保使用 Ant Design 官方推荐的 Token

- **简化设计交接**：设计师可以直接提供 Token 名称而非色值

- **支持主题切换**：通过模板管理轻松在不同主题间切换
plugins.tagline: 支持选中figma的元素获取到antd主题色对应的token值

plugins.name: Text Extractor
plugins.description:
🎥 Watch the demo video here


Plugin Features


Extract Text from Selected Figma Frames

Easily extract text from selected frames. Whether you select a single frame or multiple frames, you can quickly extract all the text within them.


Automatically Generate Variable Names

Automatically convert extracted text into variable names using camelCase format. This feature supports English text only, ensuring consistent and clean variable naming for your projects.


Create Custom Delimiter Sets

Design your own delimiter sets to wrap text with brackets, quotes, or any custom markers. Use intuitive keyboard shortcuts to apply these delimiters, enhancing your workflow for variable processing and other text transformation tasks.


Easily Copy and Paste

Effortlessly copy the extracted text and variable names to paste into Google Sheets or other tools.


Switch Between Design and Dev Modes

Support both design and dev modes, with dev mode as the default. Use design mode for a compact interface.




🎥 데모 영상 보기


플러그인 기능


Figma 프레임에서 텍스트 추출

선택한 프레임의 텍스트를 손쉽게 추출하세요. 프레임 하나를 선택하든, 여러 프레임을 선택하든 프레임 안의 모든 텍스트를 빠르게 추출할 수 있습니다.


자동 변수명 생성

추출된 텍스트를 camelCase 형식의 변수명으로 자동 변환합니다. 영어 텍스트에 최적화되어 있으며, 일관된 변수명을 통해 프로젝트의 가독성을 높입니다.


사용자 정의 구분자 세트 만들기

텍스트를 괄호나 인용 부호 등으로 감싸기 위한 구분자 세트를 만들어보세요. 직관적인 키보드 단축키로 구분자를 적용하여 변수 처리 등 텍스트 변환 작업을 더욱 효율적으로 수행할 수 있습니다.


간편한 복사 및 붙여넣기

추출한 텍스트와 변수명을 복사하여 Google Sheets 등 다른 작업 공간에 쉽게 붙여넣을 수 있습니다.


디자인 모드와 개발 모드 전환

필요에 따라 디자인 모드와 개발 모드를 전환하여 사용하세요. 기본 모드는 개발 모드이며, 디자인 모드에서는 컴팩트한 인터페이스를 제공합니다.
plugins.tagline: Extract text from frames and auto-generate variable names

plugins.name: Naming Helper
plugins.description:
# Naming Helper - 피그마 플러그인


선택된 프레임(들) 내의 모든 요소 이름을 한 번에 변경할 수 있는 피그마 플러그인입니다.


## 기능


- 선택된 프레임 내의 모든 하위 요소 이름을 일괄 변경

- 여러 프레임을 동시에 선택하여 일괄 처리 가능

- 현재 선택된 프레임 개수 표시

- 프레임이 선택되지 않았을 경우 알림 제공


## 사용 방법


1. 이름을 변경하고자 하는 프레임(들)을 선택합니다.

2. 플러그인을 실행합니다.

3. 입력 필드에 새로운 이름을 입력합니다.

4. "이름 변경하기" 버튼을 클릭합니다.

5. 프레임 내의 모든 요소 이름이 변경됩니다.
plugins.tagline: Naming Helper

plugins.name: IconBridge – Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub
plugins.description:
A powerful Figma plugin that automates icon exports, optimizes assets, and pushes them directly to GitHub—seamlessly integrating design and development. IconBridge eliminates manual file handling, ensuring every icon is correctly formatted, optimized, and instantly available for development.



✨ Key Features


  1. Optimized Icon Export – Export icons directly from Figma with automatic light/dark version generation for multi-colored icons.
  2. Seamless GitHub Integration – Push icons directly from Figma to GitHub, with automated organization and validation.
  3. Automated Pull Request Creation – IconBridge commits and opens a GitHub PR automatically, streamlining the handoff process.
  4. Secure Repository Access – Uses GitHub authentication to ensure private and controlled icon handoff.




🚀 How to Use


Quick & Optimized Icon Export

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export Icons” on the home screen.
  3. IconBridge automatically optimizes each icon, ensuring clean, lightweight SVGs.
  4. Click “Save” to download optimized icons directly to your device.


Automated Handoff to GitHub

  1. Select your icons in Figma.
  2. Click “Export to GitHub” to begin the automation.
  3. IconBridge optimizes and validates each icon before uploading.
  4. Automatically organizes icons in the correct repository folder.
  5. Creates a pull request automatically, ready for developer review.




🛠️ What You’ll Need

  1. A Figma project with icons.
  2. A GitHub repository for automated exports.




🔒 Secure & Seamless Workflow

IconBridge ensures a secure, efficient, and automated handoff process:


  1. Direct Figma-to-GitHub integration—no external storage needed.
  2. Authentication with GitHub to keep your repository secure.
  3. Fully automated workflow—eliminating manual exports, uploads, and PR creation.


🚀 Forget tedious icon management—let IconBridge automate everything from Figma to production!
plugins.tagline: Automated Icon Handoff from Figma to GitHub

plugins.name: Token Swapper
plugins.description:
To use it, simply activate the plugin, import any component from any library, and it does the rest! 🚀


https://www.loom.com/share/6d526c11f63644318e9c604193e11e3d


Effortless Token Swapping Across Files

Swap Design Tokens between your design system and working files in seconds. Maintain consistency without duplicating libraries or styles.


Full-page Token Replacement

Need to update a full design with new tokens? One click with "Swap All" updates every node, text style, and color variable instantly — no manual work required.


Intelligent Scan & Replace

Automatically scan files for elements not linked to tokens — including colors and fonts — and batch replace them with variables from your design system. Eliminate inconsistencies with a few clicks.


Cross-theme & Project Flexibility

Manage multiple projects with a single design system source. Token Swapper ensures all visual assets remain connected to their proper tokens, even across brands or themes.


Non-destructive Workflow

Token Swapper doesn’t overwrite or break your original styles. Switch between token sets and preview changes without permanent commitment — perfect for testing themes or migrating designs.


Smart Query Processing

Let the plugin process bulk token changes in the background. Your edits persist even when closing the plugin, making large updates smoother and safer.


Beta Features: More Power, More Control

Our beta tools let you go even deeper — manage font tokens, swap icons, and process entire pages. Just stay in the same token session for best results while we keep improving.


FAQs

Does this work with free Figma plans?

Yes! Token Swapper is fully compatible with all Figma plans — free included. No need for professional tiers to keep your tokens in sync.


What if I use my own token naming system?

That’s okay! As long as your token names and structure match across files, Token Swapper will recognize and replace them intelligently.


Why use Token Swapper instead of doing it manually?

Manual token swaps are time-consuming, error-prone, and hard to scale. Token Swapper automates the entire process, saving you hours of work and ensuring consistency.


Tutorials

https://www.loom.com/share/3d743648bd3643e5a50b7dff7d54bbf2

https://www.loom.com/share/b3a6f11e12734fe18da5d30106fe4c54

https://www.loom.com/share/0ec7731eb20f404d9259222377f40cef

plugins.name: Figma Variable Viewer
plugins.description:
Figma Variable Viewer is designed to help you inspect and extract Figma variables from the layers that you select. It aids in debugging, documenting, and optimizing design systems by making it easy to inspect and export variable bindings directly from your Figma document.


Variable Extraction & Presentation: When you select layers inside Figma, the plugin gathers the variables that are applied—such as layer name, property, the variable name, and the values associated for each mode in the variable's collection (e.g. Light Mode & Dark Mode). The details are displayed in a table format in a resizable window, allowing you to easily review which variables are bound to which layers and properties.


Export & Copy Functionality: Ideal for designers and engineers who want to transfer or analyze their variable data outside of Figma, improving documentation and collaboration within design systems. Export and copy features include:

  1. Export to CSV file
  2. Export to JSON file
  3. Copy All to Clipboard
  4. Copy a single variable
plugins.tagline: Inspect, export, and copy Figma variables from the layers that you select

138438.name: Figma Variable Viewer
138438.description:

Variable Extraction & Presentation: When you select layers inside Figma, the plugin gathers the variables that are applied—such as layer name, property, the variable name, and the values associated for each mode in the variable's collection (e.g. Light Mode & Dark Mode). The details are displayed in a table format in a resizable window, allowing you to easily review which variables are bound to which layers and properties.


Export & Copy Functionality: Ideal for designers and engineers who want to transfer or analyze their variable data outside of Figma, improving documentation and collaboration within design systems. Export and copy features include:

  1. Export to CSV file
  2. Export to JSON file
  3. Copy All to Clipboard
  4. Copy a single variable
138438.release_notes:
✨ NEW
 • Making public and releasing to the Figma Community

🛠️ UPDATES & FIXES
 • Colors for other modes now properly resolve to their raw value
 •  Added a filter mechanism to hide/show which variable collections you want to see in a given selection
138438.tagline: Inspect, export, and copy Figma variables from the layers that you select

Adapture makes it easy to adapt your designs for new markets—right inside Figma. By understanding your content and layout, it rewrites and translates text that fits seamlessly into your design and speaks to your audience.


No broken layouts, no manual fixes—just content that works.


Why Designers Love Adapture:


  1. Effortless Adaptation: Select your frames, set your goals, and let Adapture handle the rest. It rewrites and translates text while keeping your layout intact.
  2. Smarter Translations: Adapture analyzes your design and messaging to deliver text that matches the tone, intent, and purpose of your work.
  3. Consistent Messaging: Whether you’re creating for new audiences or adapting for different markets, Adapture helps you keep your messaging aligned and on-brand.
  4. Saves Time: Automates the heavy lifting so you can focus on creating, not fixing.


Key Features:


  1. Design-Aware Adaptation: Adapture understands your designs and rewrites text to fit your layout, intent, and audience.

plugins.name: Silent Sweep
plugins.description:
Silent Sweep is your go-to Figma plugin for effortlessly managing concealed elements in your designs. This powerful tool scans your current page, revealing all hidden layers within each frame and artboard.

With its intuitive card-based interface, you can quickly identify and select hidden elements, streamlining your cleanup process.


Key Features:


  1. Instant Detection: Automatically finds all hidden layers on your current page.
  2. Organized View: Displays hidden layers grouped by their parent frames for easy navigation.
  3. Selective Cleanup: Choose which hidden layers to remove with simple checkboxes.
  4. Real-time Updates: Refreshes automatically when you switch pages or make changes.
  5. Efficient Workflow: Helps maintain clean, organized Figma files without tedious manual searching.


Whether you're polishing up a final design or inheriting a complex file, Silent Sweep helps you maintain a tidy workspace. Say goodbye to forgotten hidden layers and hello to cleaner, more manageable Figma projects. Simplify your design process and boost your productivity with Silent Sweep – your personal cleanup assistant in Figma
plugins.tagline: Unveil and Tidy: Your Hidden Layer Ally

plugins.name: Feature-Labeler
plugins.description:
Create numbered badges and description frames for your wireframes with ease. Streamline your design documentation process by adding sequential numbered references to features and their explanations. Convenient for product specifications, user flow documentation, and design handoffs.


  1. Create a Number Badge
  2. Select the badge size (small, medium, or large)
  3. Choose a color from preset options or use the color picker
  4. Click "Create" to add a numbered badge to your design
  5. Create a Description Frame
  6. Select the frame size (small, medium, or large)
  7. Click "Create" to add a description frame with a matching number
  8. Edit Badges and Descriptions
  9. Click on any badge or description frame to edit
  10. Change numbers to reorder the sequence automatically
  11. For badges, you can also update the color
  12. Organize Documentation
  13. Place badges next to UI elements you want to reference
  14. Add explanatory text in the description frames
  15. Badges and descriptions with the same number are linked in the sequence


와이어프레임에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지와 설명 프레임을 쉽게 생성하세요. 기능과 설명에 순차적인 번호 참조를 추가하여 디자인 문서화 프로세스를 간소화합니다. 제품 사양, 사용자 플로우 문서화 및 디자인 인계에 편리하게 활용할 수 있습니다.


  1. 번호 뱃지 만들기
  2. 뱃지 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  3. 미리 설정된 색상 중에서 선택하거나 색상 선택기 사용
  4. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 디자인에 번호가 매겨진 뱃지 추가
  5. 설명 프레임 만들기
  6. 프레임 크기 선택 (small, medium, or large)
  7. "Create" 버튼을 클릭하여 일치하는 번호의 설명 프레임 추가
  8. 뱃지 및 설명 편집
  9. 편집하려는 뱃지나 설명 프레임을 클릭
  10. 번호를 변경하면 시퀀스가 자동으로 재정렬됨
  11. 뱃지의 경우 색상도 업데이트 가능
  12. 문서 정리
  13. 참조하려는 UI 요소 옆에 뱃지 배치
  14. 설명 프레임에 설명 텍스트 추가
  15. 같은 번호의 뱃지와 설명은 시퀀스에서 연결됨
plugins.tagline: Simplify wireframe annotations with numbered badges and descriptions

plugins.name: Fill Cleaner
plugins.description:
Fill Cleaner helps you maintain clean, efficient Figma files by removing redundant fills from layers. Whether it’s multiple image fills, solid colors, or gradients, the plugin preserves only the topmost fill of each type—no visual changes, just a lighter file.


✨ Smart Fill Cleaning

  1. Image fills: Keep the topmost image
  2. Color fills: Remove redundant solids
  3. Gradient fills: Retain just the top gradient
  4. CMD+K for quick commands
  5. Batch cleaning: Works on selections or entire pages


🖼️ Lummi.ai Integration

  1. Instantly apply images to selected layers
  2. Great for refreshing mockups and prototypes


🕒 When to Use

  1. Design cleanup: Tidy up before handoff
  2. File optimization: Reduce size, speed up performance
  3. After explorations: Clear leftover fills
  4. Before sharing: Ensure your files are clean
  5. With imports: Fix cluttered layers from other tools


Try Image Fill Cleaner and keep your designs sharp, efficient, and handoff-ready.

plugins.name: PropSelect
plugins.description:
PropSelect enhances your Figma workflow by allowing you to copy and paste specific properties like fill, stroke, and corner radius between elements without overwriting all properties.


Here is a YouTube video summarizing the features and working of this plugin - https://youtu.be/76v9z9xthH0


How it works:

1. Select an element: Click on an element in your design, and its properties will appear in the plugin UI.

2. Choose properties to copy: For each property (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius), you can select a checkbox to indicate which properties you want to copy. Once you're done, click the copy button to save the selected properties.

3. Paste properties: You can paste the copied properties onto one or more elements at once.


Features:

• Selective property copying: Choose exactly which properties to copy (e.g., fill, stroke, corner radius) to avoid overwriting unwanted styles.

• Multi-object pasting: Apply copied properties to multiple objects simultaneously, saving time when working with multiple elements.

• Compatibility with other methods: You can paste properties copied outside of the plugin directly. Copying properties within plugin will not override that.

• Undo support: Easily undo your last action if something goes wrong.


Tips:

• Use PropSelect to quickly replicate specific properties across multiple objects without affecting other styles.

• Perfect for maintaining consistency in your design while only changing the properties you care about.

• Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

• Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

• Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
plugins.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element

• Works well for batch edits where you want to adjust specific properties, like color or stroke width, across many elements.


Known issues:

• Does not copy underline properties or text alignment.

• Will not work on text boxes with different properties applied to individual contents.
137698.release_notes:
This version includes 2 major updates - 
1. Initially, on copying a property having a 'style' only the raw value of style was getting copied. Now, it will copy the style itself. E.g. on copying a element with fill style `Black`, the value of that style i.e. #000000 was getting copied which is now fixed to paste `Black` as fill style.
2. The stroke property initially did not capture stroke stroke direction (all sides/ top/ left/ custom, etc) and would apply it on all sides. Fixed

Please let me know if you find any bugs or have suggestions to improve.
137698.tagline: Copy and paste specific properties of an element
